result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Charles Klein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven Charles Klein is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven Charles Klein was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Steven Charles Klein in court with attorney Richard A Coad.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleas no contest to Ct. 1, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 5 years, 30 days jail w/Huber, Jail start date to be determined by DOC Agent w/in the 1st 6 months, $518.00 costs, AODA and comply, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Stip filed in 15 TR 6315 and 15 TR 7018, 9 days sentence credit, bond to be applied,
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Steven Charles Klein, appeared by jail video with Attorney Alicia Nall, special for the public defenders office. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,000 cash bond with not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid Rx, not possess any drug paraphernalia, may travel to WI for work and court, standard felony conds. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:20 pm.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
